definition: to leave one's post during working hours

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to slacken off in one's work/to go slow (as a form of strike)
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to be absent from work or school
drunken fighting/to get drunk and quarrel
to replace sb on a workshift/to substitute for
to check attendance (at school or workplace)/to monitor efficiency (of workers)
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
